page.title: 05KNIVETON AREA SCHOOLS
page.content: Children in our study block attend different schools according to where they live.There are three main villages. Kniveton is the only village with a primary school still operating,the others having lost theirs in previous years.Children in the Kniveton area attend Kniveton School until they are eleven years old and then they transfer to Queen Elizabeth's Grammar School in Ashbourne. Children from Hognaston and Atlow are taken to Hulland Ward Primary School, a large village to the south,and from there they transfer to Queen Elizabeth's Grammar School or some go to the Anthony Gell School in Wirksworth.
